Pledgie Donations

This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

Bag O' Links - 7/8/2009 07/08/2009 Another post [Elad Meidar]
  • Javascript eye for the ruby guy – a great javascript overview for all of us sinners, awesome writing and one of my favorite posts out there about javascript for idiots. :)
  • A slim light box replacement – looks nice, and a lot lighter than the common lightbox.
  • Flot – JQuery charts and graphs – this is NICE! JQuery charts. wuhoo
  • some more JQuery charting – others may like different things
  • Supercharge Routes.rb – neat tips on making your routes file cooler.
  • Accurate distance_of_time_in_words_to_now – another open source contribution by @ryanbigg.
  • JQuery jTransform – Form skinner – lot’s of fun options to skin your forms and overcome the ugliness of none Mac browsers :)
  • HTML / Javascript form enhancers – a list of possibly useful form extras.
  • Handling Javascript exception – How to handle those pesky-tesky javascript exceptions.

GitHub Treasures

  • job_fu – another async job handler.
  • monkeyshines – not sure what it does (scraper), but it has monkey in it’s name so i had too.
  • TimeFlux – billing and management.
  • switchoffthelightbeforeyouleave – interwebz light switch ( i think someone turned it off yesterday… isn’t it right Twitter?)
  • easyXSS – A javascript library providing cross-browser, cross-site messaging/method invocation.
